title.en-US: The Next Frontier for Generative AI: Business Decision Making

content.en-US:
![BLOG HERO IMAGE 02](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/4wOfs2tf1wxZsn7jNY5Pvx/b7da20ace1de35231481fd79c66cdaa7/BLOG_HERO_IMAGE_02.png) As companies evaluate how to derive value from generative AI initiatives, IDC predicts a major paradigm shift in its use with 35% of enterprises worldwide using GenAI to co-develop digital products and services by 2025, potentially doubling their revenue growth compared to their competitors.* While much has been said about the value of ChatGPT and other GenAI tools for content creation and search, the use case that I want to highlight is GenAIs ability to help us engage with data, make better decisions, and by doing so deliver greater value to the enterprise. The growing discipline of decision intelligence addresses the business need for greater velocity and accuracy by using AI to harmonize data, identify patterns, and deliver recommended actions that optimize for desired results. Today, we can benefit from AI-powered recommendations that can be executed autonomously in order to generate revenue, avoid risk, reduce CO2 emissions, and balance sustainability with service levels. Now, advancements in GenAI make it even easier to engage with data and make decisions by streamlining the process. ### Stronger together: Predictive, prescriptive, and generative AI Although ChatGPT and other generative AIs are powerful tools, they have limited value in addressing business problems. The large language models (LLMs) that power them lack structured data-processing capabilities, specific domain and market knowledge, and the context necessary to make reliable and accurate recommendations and automate processes. However, by combining a trained LLM with predictive and prescriptive AI models that are purpose-built to analyze massive amounts of data and address specific tasks, it becomes possible to identify risks and opportunities, deliver recommendations, and execute decisions through conversational interactions. For example, lets assume a logistics manager has questions about route performance. A tool like ChatGPT cannot give an answer to this question, but decision intelligence can. Using AI models designed with business knowledge and context, an LLM-powered digital agent can understand the question, then respond with relevant information and visuals in dialogue with the user. That platform can go even further by delivering real-time recommendations, then executing them in response to the managers instructions seamlessly writing back to systems of record and data sources as a result of that conversational interaction. In this way, GenAI and LLMs become the gateway to data, recommendations, and execution. Instead of spreadsheets or static charts that leave the burden on people, AI makes it possible to engage with a platform conversationally in order to make better, faster decisions. This type of contextual human/machine interaction has been dreamed about for decades. Today, it is a reality. ### No hallucinations, only facts One concern with GenAI has been accuracy. You may have read stories of AI-created hallucinations generated content that seems plausible, but isnt factual. Its natural to be cautious about trusting GenAI with critical business needs you cant afford to risk a hallucination impacting your supply chain, manufacturing, or customer service. When used with predictive and prescriptive AI, an LLM can only return accurate results because it only analyzes information imported directly from the clients systems of record and data sources. This needs to be emphasized, because it is crucial to understand that we can build trust in GenAI as a business solution. An LLM interface adds a new and intuitive way of engaging with data and decisions, creating a solution that is more powerful than the individual components alone. ### The future is AI-powered A [recent IDC study](https://meet.aeratechnology.com/idc-what-every-executive-needs-to-know-ai)** revealed that enterprises actively using AI to accelerate and improve decision making experienced improvements across a number of metrics including product or service innovation, employee retention, customer retention, and risk management. As the value of AI-powered decision making becomes clear, we will see more organizations joining the ranks of leaders by adopting this technology. All of this means we can look forward to a more promising future where business decisions are easier to make and execute, thanks to AI innovation.

Learn how Aera empowers enterprises with Generative AI - read our press announcement.

A version of this article was previously published on the Nasdaq blog.

* Source: IDC FutureScape: Worldwide Generative Artificial Intelligence 2024 Predictions, IDC #US51291623, October 2023

** Source: IDC White Paper, commissioned by Aera Technology, What Every Executive Needs to Know About AI-Powered Decision Intelligence, IDC #US51338623, November 2023

title.en-US: How AI is Shaping the Future of Work

content.en-US:
![Fred - Future of Work blog 07-2024 - Hero](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/60lRGHNjfT5BwgFY5Fs0mZ/e22103398840f8664ceac3de36dde209/Fred_-_Future_of_Work_blog_07-2024_-_Hero.jpg) As digitization continues to evolve the global economy, we will see the competitive advantage AI delivers in talent recruitment and retention. Teams today want to use intuitive, innovative technology that makes their work more rewarding, productive, and enjoyable. Companies that prioritize AI initiatives will be able to offer this type of experience, and will also create new roles to optimize the use of this technology and scale it across the enterprise. These companies will have the edge in hiring and retaining the most dedicated, knowledgeable workers. To illustrate why these companies will succeed, lets look at one growing application of AI technology: digitizing and automating business decision making. ### New challenges demand new ways of working The speed of business and the complexity of decisions today mean that manual, time-intensive processes and tools are no longer practical. Countless decisions are being left unmade, negatively impacting service levels, efficiency, and sustainability. AI solves these problems, improving how teams work by letting machines do what they do best: find patterns in big data, analyze potential alternatives and trade-offs, and recommend the best course of action at the moment of greatest impact. The AI can deliver plain-language recommendations in real time that users can easily execute. Teams still can dive into the data behind the decision or modify these recommendations if necessary but as the AI learns both from user interactions and the outcomes of past decisions, teams build trust and confidence in the machine-generated recommendations. At the same time, the AI platform optimizes future decisions based on continuous input and analysis. ### Early adopters benefit from AI in the workplace I recently spoke with the Value Chain team at a global steel manufacturer that has adopted AI-powered decision making to manage the end-to-end order lifecycle. This dedicated, small group is on the front lines of the business and carries large responsibilities. The team must ensure that complex customer orders are delivered on deadline, in addition to meeting internal goals and priorities. Responding to disruptions in customer orders used to be a stressful, time-consuming process. Team members had to access different systems to gather information, then put all of it into spreadsheets and perform numerous calculations to find the best course of action. Today, AI performs the calculations and presents both the analysis and the recommended action in a single user interface. Team members review the recommendation (for example, substituting a product in stock for one thats now unavailable) and can execute the change with a single click. This makes for a less-stressful working environment, and better relationships with both customers and colleagues. ### AI creates new roles and opportunities In working with early adopters of AI for decision making, Ive realized that there is often a gap between the way leaders believe decisions are being made in the field and how those decisions are actually being made at the distribution center or manufacturing plant. By digitizing decision-making processes across an organization, AI reveals new opportunities for efficiency and improvement. Companies are responding by creating new roles for workers who will optimize these human/machine interactions. These people will be responsible for building, guiding, and improving AI-driven processes. For example, decision architects will apply knowledge of processes (such as supply chain planning or procurement) to design AI models and decision-making logic. Decision analysts will guide the technology to improve and scale those processes. One leading global technology company is adding product teams and hiring AI skill developers, decision architects, and product owners to meet demand as they scale the use of AI for decision automation. Instead of replacing jobs, AI is creating new roles to support increased digitization and automation. This is the future of the workplace where siloed business processes, manual calculations, and human biases are no longer part of how we make decisions. The companies adopting AI today will have a competitive advantage in recruiting tomorrows talented employees and maintaining them longer in roles they love.

A version of this article was previously published on the Nasdaq blog.

title.en-US: AIs Positive Impact on Business Decision Making: What We Learned at 2024 Gartner Events

content.en-US:
![Gartner recap blog hero](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/4CWbINF1NFlHOlxp0p5axJ/bfdd9049cece40dd320a9c510a8f2f2f/Gartner_recap_blog_hero.jpg) We recently attended the Gartner Supply Chain Symposium/Xpo in Orlando and Barcelona and the Gartner Data & Analytics Summit in London. At our speaking sessions and conversations on the conference floor, there was a great deal of excitement around AI and the positive impacts Decision Intelligence is having on business performance, sustainability, and the future of work. Here are three key themes that emerged from those conversations across the three events. ### Decision Intelligence is delivering rapid value for early adopters Our CEO, Fred Laluyaux, has been a passionate advocate for Decision Intelligence for many years. We're happy to see on the shop floor today, and throughout this conference, that the concept of decision automation and Decision Intelligence is really now becoming a megatrend, Fred said at our session in Barcelona. That value resonated in the stories shared by our customers who have pioneered AI to digitize, augment, and automate business decisions. In Barcelona, Francis Castro, vice president of customer technology at Unilever, joined Fred on stage to discuss how Decision Intelligence has helped his company become more agile and efficient. Speed matters. Today, speed is the currency, Francis said. He described why Unilever adopted Aera Decision Cloud as part of a simplified technology landscape that enables Unilever to operate more quickly and efficiently forming a layer of Decision Intelligence over their systems of record and differentiation. This is where we believe that Decision Intelligence is really supporting that differentiation layer, to get better automated decisions, Francis said. With AI, he said, teams now can answer questions about how best to serve customers, optimize inventory levels, and position stock at distribution centers. In Orlando, Wendy Herrick, senior vice president of customer operations, North America at Unilever, shared the positive impacts of Decision Intelligence for the business as a whole. It's not just looking at business metrics, right? It's really looking across all your stakeholders, Wendy said from ensuring growth and profitability for shareholders, to growing the business efficiently, to ensuring that employees have the best possible experience. Are you the employer of choice? Wendy continued. Are you creating the jobs of the future? Are you moving the transactional low value work out of the day-to-day and really creating roles for the future where you have decision makers, not data gatherers and reporters? ### More companies now trust AI to enable better, faster decision making In recent years, the digitization of the economy has created unprecedented challenges for global supply chains. As Fred noted in our speaking session in Orlando, even at large organizations with hundreds of planners, the speed, granularity, and complexity of decisions has reached a point where people cannot keep up. Decision Intelligence has addressed these challenges for global leaders in CPG, pharmaceuticals, oil & gas, technology, and manufacturing. Those early adopters are finding success by focusing not just on technology, but on understanding and improving decision-making processes and building trust in AI to make those decisions. Any planner that I've ever been introduced to they know their category, right? Wendy said. Unlike other solutions where decisions are made in a black box without transparency, Aera gives users a clear view of the data and logic behind each recommendation. As Wendy explained, The beauty of it was, its a clear box you can see what it's doing, you can see what it's recommending, and the user can actually see what's going on, so that trust starts to build. Over time, continuous learning and optimization result in fewer exceptions and fewer recommendations being rejected. As a result, planners have more time to focus on high-value and strategic decisions, reducing the time and effort required to make decisions. ### AI makes it possible to address decisions that previously went unmade In our London speaking session, Moving from BI to AI with Decision Intelligence, Fred and Marinaldo Gomes, global head of IT at British American Tobacco (BAT), discussed how enterprises are overcoming data challenges, capturing business value, and reducing bias in decision-making processes. Marinaldo described how BAT, a global company with hundreds of suppliers and a worldwide network of factories and support facilities, moved from a traditional sequential supply chain to a system of modern, digitally-enabled supply networks. Without Decision Intelligence, Marinaldo said, planners had to respond to alerts from the APS by manually gathering data and running scenarios in order to determine the best response to challenges. Today, Aera integrates data and systems across BATs supply chain into a central control tower for autonomous decision making. This process of digitizing and automating decisions has improved the companys ability to react to potential shortages that could impact demand, fulfillment, or cost. In one instance, Marinaldo said Aera had reduced the time spent on performing analysis by 90 percent. The idea now is to close the loop, Marinaldo said, incorporating more data sources and freeing team members time to focus on higher-value tasks. Fred noted that, while much attention has been paid to black swan events and disruptions, AI is making it possible for teams to optimize the thousands of micro-events that occur constantly throughout the day. Decision Intelligence not only improves the quality of decisions, but shines a light on the opportunity to address decisions that were previously left unmade. ### 2024 will be a pivotal year for Decision Intelligence The biggest takeaway from our conversations at recent Gartner events was the importance of taking the first step toward improving decision making with AI. As weve heard many times from customers, the key is to have a clear vision for what you want to achieve, then build the right team and choose partners who can help you achieve it. The companies that move to implement AI-powered decision making and decision automation today will be positioned to gain value in the near term and to create and adopt new ways of working that will deliver increasing value over time. *Meet Aera in September at the North American Supply Chain Executive Summit [click here](https://www.aeratechnology.com/events) to learn more.*

title.en-US: Myth vs. Fact: Four Realities of Applying AI to Decision Making

content.en-US:
![AERA BLOG POST FACT MYTH HERO](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/43RkyuhHLZlcPyDjdzNIU9/d5c88b2681383baac89f8a5b14fec395/AERA_BLOG_POST_FACT_MYTH_HERO.jpg) Advances in AI are reducing complexity in executing decisions across the enterprise and revealing new value from decision automation.

Consider a global consumer packaged goods leader that started the decision intelligence journey focused on automating forecasting decisions in the U.S., its largest and most complex market. The technology began quickly learning the patterns of the demand at each state level, producing initial results within a few months. The company has reduced forecast error from 68% to 25% and is scaling now to service areas in EMEA, APAC, and LATAM, with an eye on improving supply planning in the near future.

While early adopters are paving the way for others to take the first step, misconceptions about AI-powered decision making exist. Lets start by addressing four myths. ### Myth #1: Decision intelligence is only a concept yet to be implemented

Fact: Decision intelligence software defined by IDC as packaged for fully or partially automating all steps in the decision-making process is actively improving cost, revenue, service, sustainability, and more.

According to IDC research*, AI-powered decisions drove up to 20% improvement across a range of business metrics for enterprise leaders. In the study, leaders were defined as those successfully operationalizing AI for better decisions through use of decision intelligence solutions. The technology is enabling teams to understand, evaluate, and improve their decisioning processes. They can capture knowledge about how decisions are being made and ensure consistency and continual learning all factors that deliver tangible value. ### Myth #2: Decision intelligence requires perfect data __Fact:__ Perfect data is an enterprise myth that many have been chasing for years. The reality is, leaders and their teams have to make decisions with incomplete information at speed. This is where AI applications like decision intelligence help bridge the gap. Through a data model that integrates all available data in a harmonized layer, users can apply machine learning and decision intelligence techniques to predict missing or incomplete data gaining a starting point to make informed decisions. By collecting data about expected and actual outcomes, leaders can also understand if their data and the decision logic they are working with is delivering the intended results. This ability to work with incomplete data and advanced logic at speed and scale will differentiate the winners from the rest. ### Myth #3: Decision intelligence will result in loss of control over decisions __Fact:__ Trusting AI to make and execute decisions requires users to be engaged in the process. It requires explainable AI and a transparent user experience, with full visibility into the data and intelligence behind every recommendation and decision. In contrast to a black box where workings arent clear, decision intelligence technology can provide transparency and be auditable, allowing users to understand the basis for recommendations. This type of intelligent human/machine collaboration drives confidence in the process and enables adoption and outcomes. Whether users are reviewing recommendations and then manually executing the decisions (human-on-the-loop) or identifying groups of routine or specific decisions that can be fully automated (human-out-of-the loop), teams must be able to see the rationale and context for the recommendations (glass box). This will build the trust needed between people and machines to innovate, scale, and maximize results. ### Myth #4: Decision intelligence eliminates jobs __Fact:__ Automating routine work and enabling time for other priorities are just a few workforce benefits of decision intelligence. Its application is also proving a driver in attracting and retaining talent people want to work with intuitive technology that speeds results and delivers efficiencies. One global CPG leader changed its organizational structure to accelerate a digital supply chain prioritizing decision intelligence in this evolution. The critical key to success? The company created the right culture for testing, learning, and adoption. Employees were motivated by clear goals and celebrated milestones as AI-generated recommendations were accepted and higher percentages of automated decisions were realized. Another supply chain executive leading the technologys enterprise-wide scaling is now defining decision-specific roles and responsibilities for her team, following the companys initial test nine months ago.

We are already seeing decision architects, decision engineers, and other decision-centric roles emerge as companies prepare for the future of decision making.

### Adopt a decision-centric mindset for the future AI-led decision-centric initiatives are enabling companies to empower their workforce and communities, deliver time-to-value and value-over-time, and compete effectively in our digital world. The time to embrace this revolution is now.

A version of this article was previously published on the Nasdaq blog.

Hear from companies that are pioneering AI for decision making. Join us at AeraHUB 24, the Decision Intelligence summit.

*Source: IDC White Paper, commissioned by Aera Technology, What Every Executive Needs to Know About AI-Powered Decision Intelligence, IDC #US51338623, November 2023

title.en-US: Decision Intelligence is Going Mainstream: Seize the Competitive Edge as an Early Adopter

content.en-US:
![DI Goes Mainstream - BLOG HERO IMAGE](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/6dtvvRYhhyuE5N8jE3kpUo/2166ab7151e3a327911030a274b88f82/DI_Goes_Mainstream_-_BLOG_HERO_IMAGE.jpg) Decision Intelligence (DI) is rapidly emerging as a pivotal technology for companies aiming to enhance decision outcomes amidst the challenges of increasing data volumes, limited employee capacity, accelerated operational cycles, and growing complexity. In recent weeks, multiple analyst firms have emphasized the significance of DI, highlighting it as a critical technology poised to deliver substantial benefits to organizations that embrace it. Analysts project that mainstream adoption will occur within the next 2 to 5 years, suggesting that by 2029, the majority of companies will have integrated DI into their operations. This could range from augmenting decision making with recommendations to fully automating decision execution, all in pursuit of superior organizational outcomes. As DI deployment accelerates, early adopters stand to gain immediate advantages. These include real-time analysis of vast amounts of internal and external data and the ability to generate informed recommendations across all decision-making levels, from tactical to strategic. Companies leveraging DI will be better positioned to achieve their objectives, from enhancing customer satisfaction to optimizing revenue management, thanks to their ability to make faster, more informed decisions. Gartner outlines the need for DI platforms in its key findings in the 2024 Gartner Market Guide for Decision Intelligence Platforms: To improve decision quality, it is not enough to offer fragmented and non-context-specific, data-driven insights through business unit-level dashboards, data science predictions or a variety of other, siloed analytical and AI applications. They go on to define what a Decision Intelligence Platform is in the following graphic: ![Screenshot 2024-09-10 at 10.57.44AM](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/5OgbAmV7EYrFPSJcubkrqQ/71d31b2ee45d04d24e111482a9c54857/blogimage.jpg)

Aera Technology was recognized as a Representative Vendor in the 2024 Gartner Market Guide for Decision Intelligence Platforms. Additionally, IDC published the IDC MarketScape: Worldwide Decision Intelligence Platforms 2024 Vendor Assessment, naming Aera Technology as a Leader.

We think this report further underscores the unique value of Decision Intelligence, particularly in how it distinguishes itself from other technologies particularly in regards to the collection and utilization of the data fundamental to making business critical decisions. Specifically, the IDC Marketscape states:

Traditionally, decision making would largely involve ensuring that decision-makers have access to the data that they need to make decisions, relying heavily on human interpretation of data while being aided by basic analysis. However, given the exponential growth in data, the fact that organizations make more complex decisions and on a more frequent basis requires organizations to seek solutions that will enable them to govern and orchestrate decision making at scale.

It is also important to understand that decision intelligence is different from business intelligence (BI) and artificial intelligence (AI)/machine learning (ML). In business intelligence, users can understand trends, outliers, and track metrics, while with AI/ML, it allows for predictive and pattern recognition capabilities. Decision intelligence incorporates different aspects of both BI and AI/ML but focuses on automating aspects of decision-making and based on the complexity of the decision will require humans in the loop.

This IDC Marketscape explanation is important. Taking the details a step further, its worth pointing out that existing technologies aggregate data between applications and serve it up in dashboards, with no improvements to latency and maintaining silos that limit access to information. In addition, this approach requires time-consuming human intervention to review the data, make a decision, and execute the action to close the loop. Not only is this approach difficult to scale it suffers from transparency, speed and accuracy limitations, and doesnt consider or communicate the subsequent impacts to other parts of the business, creating organizational friction and risk for poor decision outcomes. This is why the analyst community has projected an adoption horizon of 2-5 years, because solving these existing legacy problems cant wait. Leading companies have recognized this, of course, resulting in many trying to build in-house solutions to achieve the flexibility, scalability, and accuracy necessary for modern decision making. Unfortunately, companies that have tried to build these capabilities in-house find that creating and maintaining these homegrown solutions is neither sustainable nor satisfactory. The takeaway here is, now is the time to start your Decision Intelligence journey. __Aera Decision Cloud is built to deliver the results your company needs__ Aera Decision Cloud is purpose-built to address the challenges mentioned above, providing the AI-driven capabilities necessary for optimal enterprise decision making. The platform enhances and automates decision making processes through its integrated components, including the Decision Data Model, Aera Cortex, Aera Skills, and Aera Developer. These tools empower organizations to create customized decision workflows tailored to their specific needs, ensuring seamless visibility, analysis, collaboration, and execution across all levels of the enterprise. We are particularly proud to be recognized for best-in-class capabilities in Decision Design, Decision Engineering, and Decision Orchestration: - __Decision Design__ provides functionality for users to define business goals or desired outcomes, map decision-making workflows, including feedback loops and approval points, and identify choices and constraints that limit the available options of a decision maker. - __Decision Engineering__ provides functionality to organize the available data using semantic and/or ontological frameworks, analyze the data using a range of use case-specific methods that may include simulation, optimization, descriptive, and predictive analysis. The output of this process is a prioritized list of impact-weighted options that are either presented to a decision maker or can be fully automated by the platform. - __Decision Orchestration__ provides functionality to monitor all elements of the decision-making workflow (e.g., rules, algorithms, data sets, approval hierarchies, goals, constraints, decisions, and so forth) and enables their ongoing or periodic adjustment based on automated and human-generated feedback loops. Orchestration also enables ongoing learning about decision-making processes and outcomes of decisions by providing functionality to catalog and analyze these decision intelligence artifacts. __Which organizations will benefit from Aera Decision Cloud?__ Aera Decision Cloud is purposefully designed to manage complex operations, generate recommendations, augment and automate a range of decision processes from small and granular through large and strategic delivering both a shortened time to value and increasing value over time for customers. Our platform is delivering millions of accepted recommendations for leading companies in CPG, life sciences, high tech, industrial manufacturing, higher education, and more. __How to get started__

After reading the 2024 Gartner Market Guide for Decision Intelligence Platforms and the IDC MarketScape: Worldwide Decision Intelligence Platforms 2024 Vendor Assessment excerpt, reach out to our team to learn more about starting your Decision Intelligence journey. We can help you begin to see results in approximately 4-6 weeks by understanding your unique needs and challenges, then providing:

- __Recommendations for the most impactful use cases:__ Based on our work with many large, global enterprises, we and our partners can recommend the top use cases for your industry. - __Packaged skills and test drives:__ With Skills, Aera digitizes decisions and orchestrates systems across supply chain, procurement, finance, marketing and trade promotions, and more. We offer a number of packaged skills that you can deploy rapidly with an Aera Test Drive. - __Data harmonization and ingestion:__ The Aera Decision Data Model is designed to drastically reduce the time and effort spent on aggregating, harmonizing, and labeling datasets. Data is automatically refreshed in near-real-time made possible by Aeras patented Data Crawler technology and internet-scale data architecture.

To learn more about the benefits of Decision Intelligence, schedule your personalized demo today.

Gartner, Market Guide for Decision Intelligence Platforms, Erick Brethenoux, Pieter den Hamer, David Pidsley, Alys Woodward, Raghvender Bhati, Abed Ajraou, 18 July 2024.

See you there!

title.en-US: Emerging Roles and Opportunities in the Age of Decision Intelligence

content.en-US:
![AdobeStock 493221997 (1)](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/Y55PpUa4mvliBHLUuRJ19/4ffe598fceb4840bd59f8df6ec97ab56/AdobeStock_493221997__1_.jpeg)

Organizations today are increasingly seeking ways to streamline internal processes, enhance decision-making, and sharpen their competitive edge. As highlighted in our blog post, [Decision Intelligence is Going Mainstream: Seize the Competitive Edge as an Early Adopter](https://www.aeratechnology.com/blogs/decision-intelligence-is-going-mainstream-seize-the-competitive-edge-as-an-early-adopter), decision intelligence (DI) can empower organizations with a unique advantage by digitizing and automating decisions, transforming operations, facilitating collaboration, and ultimately improving financial outcomes. This technological shift has led to the emergence of specialized roles that ensure the successful adoption and integration of DI into ongoing business operations.

### Applying Decision Intelligence: Key Skills and Expertise

Professionals in this field use analytics, data science, and engineering skills to implement decision intelligence platforms, optimizing decision-making processes for organizations. By integrating AI and advanced analytics, they design, monitor, and refine decision models, serving as a crucial liaison between business and technical teams to enhance collaboration and automation. As more companies adopt DI platforms, the demand will grow for talent capable of managing these systems and driving strategic and tactical decisions. Experience with data science, optimization, software engineering, and communication will be essential, creating opportunities for those interested in working in this rapidly expanding and promising field. Following is an overview of the skills a decision intelligence leader should master to be successful in decision intelligence. 

#### Designing Strategic Decision-Making Frameworks

Strategists in decision intelligence play a critical role in understanding the interplay between business processes, data, and decision-making. These experts ensure that decision frameworks align with organizational goals, identifying internal and external data required to refine recommendations and deliver measurable results. This becomes especially crucial when scaling DI, as it involves not only modeling decisions but also optimizing the entire decision-making process across the organization.

The skills needed to excel in this role are still evolving, but the foundational requirements have been highlighted in our webinar, [How Decision Architects and AI Platforms are Transforming Work and Value](https://meet.aeratechnology.com/webinar/how-decision-architects-and-ai-platforms-are-transforming-work-and-value-september-10-2024?_gl=1*m6oyvx*_gcl_au*ODAyODA3MjA2LjE3Mjk2MDk2NTc.), co-hosted with EY. In this webinar, experts discuss how to create these frameworks and bridge the gap between business and technology for large-scale DI implementation.

#### Bridging the Gap Between Business and Technology

Success in decision intelligence (DI) relies on professionals who can align business needs with technical solutions, creating a strong partnership between these two areas. Individuals in this field must understand both business strategy and technical capabilities, capturing complex problems and turning them into data-driven solutions. They design decision models that are technically sound and aligned with business goals, with the goal of increasing efficiency, reducing costs, addressing critical but unmade decisions, and improving customer satisfaction. A solid foundation in data science, AI, and advanced analytics is crucial, along with knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning, and predictive modeling. Equally important is the ability to communicate technical insights to non-technical stakeholders, turning analytical findings into understandable and actionable business strategies through strong storytelling and data visualization. Professionals must also lead cross-functional teams, ensuring alignment of AI models with strategic priorities and driving change management. This blend of technical expertise, strategic thinking, and communication ensures that the decision intelligence platforms these professionals deploy continue to deliver value as the business evolves.

#### Taking a Holistic View of Decision-Making

A clear differentiator of decision intelligence from existing legacy systems  such as business intelligence (BI), supply chain planning (SCP), and other solutions  is the ability to take a comprehensive view of all available data to ensure alignment and consistency of decision execution across all business functions. This requires analyzing how decisions in one area, such as supply chain, affect others like procurement, finance, and logistics, ultimately upholding the broader business strategy. DI professionals create frameworks that identify and address conflicting decisions with the aim to reduce organizational friction, break down silos, and foster cross-functional communication and collaboration. They also account for interdependencies among various functions, allowing them to pinpoint potential bottlenecks or conflicts early, preventing conflict and ensuring smooth operations. By incorporating data insights and predictive analytics, decision intelligence professionals ensure that the decisions ultimately made are both timely and aligned with long-term goals. This holistic approach empowers organizations with a newfound ability to adapt quickly to market changes while maintaining strategic focus even in the face of disruptions.

#### Scaling and Optimizing

Scaling decision intelligence can be a challenge, especially in large organizations with diverse business units or global operations. DI professionals ensure that decision models are both adaptable and composable, designing them to accommodate varying data sets, market conditions, and operational needs. This requires building flexible frameworks that evolve with the organization, ensuring consistent decision-making outcomes as it scales. Optimization is crucial to maintain speed and accuracy, and requires fine-tuning algorithms to leverage real-time insights and integrate data sources seamlessly. Automation and augmentation are also key to reducing manual tasks, allowing teams to focus on strategic activities while preserving decision quality. Effective scaling also requires aligning DI models with strategic priorities, ensuring that automation supports both immediate needs and long-term goals. By balancing adaptability and precision, DI professionals create resilient solutions that drive continuous growth and efficiency throughout the organization

#### Managing Change and Adoption

Integrating AI into decision-making processes requires careful change management to ensure a smooth transition and successful adoption. Professionals in this field play a crucial role in not only aligning technology with existing human roles but making teams comfortable with the transition to decision intelligence. This is accomplished by ensuring that AI augments rather than replaces the contributions of team members. Decision intelligence leaders focus on training and guiding employees to use new tools effectively, helping them to understand how AI can augment their decision-making capabilities. By fostering a culture that embraces innovation and continuous learning, these experts reduce resistance to change and promote confidence in AI-driven processes. Their efforts not only accelerate user adoption but also improve the speed and quality of decisions by enabling teams to make data-driven choices more efficiently. This thoughtful approach to managing change ensures that AI integration delivers sustainable improvements, optimizing both individual performance and overall organizational outcomes.

### Why These Skills are Essential

In the evolving landscape of decision intelligence, specific expertise is crucial for organizations seeking to scale decision-making, optimize processes, and align operational execution with strategic goals. By investing in skilled professionals, companies can achieve better outcomes, accelerate automation, and cultivate a culture of continuous improvement, ensuring long-term success in a data-driven world.

While these capabilities are still emerging, there is significant opportunity for those who wish to become pioneers in decision intelligence. By pursuing an educational path to gain expertise in this area, individuals can position themselves as leaders in this growing field. We encourage our readers to explore the training available through Aera Technology and invite them to participate in live sessions during [AeraHub 2024](https://www.aeratechnology.com/aerahub-2024?utm_campaign=FY25_Q4_GLOBE_EVNT_Aera_Hub2024&utm_source=marketing&utm_medium=alison).

Together, we aim to empower the next generation of leaders in decision intelligence, helping them build the foundation of effective, scalable, and integrated decision-making systems.

title.en-US: The Next Chapter of Aera: Empowering Enterprises with People-Centric Decision Intelligence

content.en-US:
![blogimage1](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/3KZdTR5djc4YMyZrpD5aRy/1ee3b2f6f6e4a742d6d3404c56739f13/blogimage1.jpg) Since our founding in 2017, Aera Technology has embarked on a transformative journey one marked by unwavering commitment to a clear vision that has guided us from day one. From the start, we recognized a significant shift driven by the digitization of our economy. This shift spurred the rapid acceleration of business cycles, leading to an exponential increase in the volume and complexity of decisions that companies must navigate to stay competitive. We identified two critical consequences of this new landscape: 1. __Inefficiencies in Traditional Organizational Structures__
Conventional organizational designs structured as deep, hierarchical pyramids are ill-equipped to handle the speed and pressure of modern business demands. The reliance on large teams layered over transactional systems creates a bottleneck that slows decision-making and stifles agility. 2. __The Emergence of Digitally Native Decisions__
In this fast-paced environment, new types of decisions are born from digital data and complexities that only a digital system can manage effectively. ### Breaking Barriers: Eliminating Inefficiencies and Silos This realization set the stage for our innovation: a platform capable of supporting and automating decisions, driving businesses forward with unprecedented speed and intelligence. We have believed that removing human inefficiencies and biases from decision-making processes is essential for sustainable growth. Traditional organizations are often weighed down by silos that separate data and expertise, making it difficult to achieve seamless, impactful performance. By breaking down these barriers, and unifying data and expertise, we empower businesses to operate with greater cohesion and clarity, enhancing their ability to adapt and excel. Our journey began with a vision for a more agile world where decision-making isnt constrained by outdated structures or fragmented data. By embedding intelligence into the very fabric of business operations, Aera supports a future where performance isn't just maintained its accelerated. It was a vision where artificial intelligence (AI), data analytics, and automation now recognized as __decision intelligence__ would fundamentally transform the way global businesses operate. ![blogimage2](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/2RCxgpnPN80ilUx2VYlxDA/44826e30eb72fb4d5f7e86b378786f36/blogimage2.jpg)

Aera combines AI, data & analytics, and automation to streamline how businesses operate.

This vision wasnt driven by the appeal of cutting-edge technology alone; we believed AI would unlock a new era of efficiency, reducing human-based inefficiencies and supporting more sustainable economies. Partnering with some of the worlds largest companies, we pioneered this vision, building a software platform that digitizes, augments, and automates decision-making a platform that doesnt just understand data but actively recommends, acts, and continuously learns from every decision made. ![blogimage3](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/4RFJ1MgrvLhL6Eab3rZcqV/172eebf26d74db178bbfb6db0a5b4174/blogimage3.jpg)

Aera doesnt just understand data but actively recommends, acts, and continuously learns from every decision made.

### Introducing People-Centric Decision Intelligence Aera has always been committed to empowering your workforce, and at [AeraHUB 24](https://www.aeratechnology.com/aerahub-2024) we announced taking our commitment to a new level: Our latest release of the __Aera Decision Cloud__ now makes decision intelligence truly __people-centric__. This people-first approach means that your team can make the full range of decisions from automated, structured decisions with humans out of the loop, all the way to complex, situational ones with human input greatly enhancing their impact and productivity. The result? Your people can focus on innovation, creativity, and higher-value work, leaving monotonous tasks behind. ![blogimage4](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/6GRgpD6KjGZBYBecKl4fWt/d716cc80084af806005f53d9e1646849/blogimage4.jpg)

Aera now supports the full gamut of decision-making, from structured decisions with humans out of the loop, all the way to situational decisions with humans in the loop.

### Advancements Transforming the Aera Decision Cloud To a global audience at [AeraHUB 24](https://www.aeratechnology.com/aerahub-2024), we introduced our vision of people-centric decision-making with the launch of __three groundbreaking innovations__ in the Aera Decision Cloud. Together with a revamped homepage, these advancements aim to empower users with an integrated system of intelligence that automates routine decisions, models scenarios for strategic decision-making, and supports execution and tracking across the full spectrum of enterprise decisions. This bold release represents not just new features but a transformative shift in how teams work, collaborate, and make decisions. ![blogimage5](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/AO2A2Bpij9u9MkwU9YHyD/065f5129bfac60e04d2c3307e9bf65dc/blogimage5.jpg)

The Aera Decision Cloud delivers three new areas of Innovation: Workspaces, Agentic AI, and the new Control Room.

__1. Aera Workspaces: Comprehensive Tools for Decision-Makers__ As part of an __updated homepage__ design, the new __Aera Workspaces__ feature brings the full power of Aeras data and intelligence into users hands through a beautifully enhanced, intuitive interface. With the agent-based __Aera Chat__ function, or through voice commands in natural language, Workspaces answers complex questions with fast, accurate responses in real time, acting like a secure, context-aware ChatGPT tailored for your supply chainaccurate, immediate, and always on. ![Product announcement blog - image - Calc Model](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/40bi6CSW3CpmPbtbrfR0H2/0554dc091941648fdeecf9c562ca6997/Product_announcement_blog_-_image_-_Calc_Model.jpg)

The Aera Decision Clouds Workspaces offer a single environment where users can perform everything from real-time queries to simulations and what-if scenarios using Calc Modeling.

Workspaces, a new component of the expanded homepage, enables users to build custom models and perform real-time simulations using Aeras new Calc Engine, putting advanced simulation capabilities directly in the hands of end users. Additionally, Workspaces allows users to take direct action. While Aera historically executed actions based on recommendations, now users can initiate any action themselves with just a single click, making decision execution faster and easier than ever. This functionality fundamentally transforms the work experience, empowering your team to make and act on decisions seamlessly. The collaborative capabilities of Aera Workspaces promote collective input and shared insights, further enhancing the decision-making process across teams. __2. Aera Agentic AI: Real-Time Solutions for Complex Decisions__ __Aera Agentic AI__ brings a new level of adaptability and intelligence to decision-making by harnessing multiple AI agents to handle unstructured data from various sources, turning complex information into actionable insights and managing intricate decision workflows with ease. As part of this new flexibility, developers can design decision workflows and models using natural language, making it easier to innovate and collaborate. Agentic AI can extract relevant information from unstructured data sources, such as PDFs, images, and forms, and integrate that data into automated decision flows that provide recommendations and take appropriate actions. This capability fully automates repetitive, routine decisions, like processing claims, freeing up valuable time and resources. ![Product announcement blog - image - agentic AI](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/kVjk543Kt18KBmLwhI3pg/e06461818b8f7828d92d0dada968d8f0/Product_announcement_blog_-_image_-_agentic_AI.jpg)

The Aera Decision Clouds Agentic AI is a groundbreaking engine that enables real-time, unstructured data processing and dynamic decision-making.

Together, these new capabilities Workspaces and Agentic AI now broaden the range of decisions that Aera can support and impact. Every decision is recorded within what we call a __Decision Intelligence Network__: a system that learns from each decision in real time, whether structured or situational, creating an ever-evolving repository of insights and actions. This intelligence captures the invaluable tribal knowledge traditionally held by individuals, empowering your organization to identify, scale, and automate best practices with ease. Think of it as every team member actively contributing to a shared, dynamic intelligence a lasting memory that continuously enhances the collective expertise across the network. ![blogimage6](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/4aYTDvyS8pDn7FHZv0WAkP/2fcb2c9bb852c60853c4022e4c71102e/blogimage6.jpg)

You can leverage the full power of Aera over the entire entire spectrum of decision making, creating what we call the Decision Intelligence Network that learns from every decision made.

__3. Aera Control Room: Enhanced Visibility and Decision Tracking__ Much like an air traffic network or a power utilities network, the __Aera Control Room__, serves as a central command center for administrators and decision architects, providing a comprehensive, real-time view of everything happening across the decision intelligence network. It provides full visibility across data crawlers, processes, data science workflows, users, and most critically, decisions both structured and situational. Aera proactively monitors activities and notifies you if there is an issue, and as an administrator or decision architect, you get complete visibility into every job and its status. You can track user activity, see which insights are actively used, and monitor data storage. For decision architects, understanding the performance of Skills and how users interact with them is essential for continuously improving decision-making throughout the organization. Control Room enables you to track recommendations, assess automation levels, and measure impact, empowering decision architects to refine processes and make the system smarter and more responsive over time. This is the essence of true decision intelligence: with Control Room, youre not simply managing individual decisionsyoure cultivating a fully integrated, adaptive network that drives smarter business at every level. ### Redefining How Teams Work and Innovate with People-Centric Intelligence With these new features, Aera Decision Cloud moves beyond solving isolated business challenges to fundamentally reshape the decision-making landscape, fostering strategic thinking, seamless collaboration, and continuous improvement. By integrating __Aera Workspaces, Agentic AI__, and the new __Control Room__, weve built a __Decision Intelligence Network__ that empowers users to innovate, automate, and track decisions effectively. This holistic approach supports both structured and situational decision-making, ensuring that businesses can adapt, scale, and thrive in a competitive environment where decision-making must be faster, smarter, and more impactful than ever before. These innovations go beyond addressing specific issues; they create an integrated system of intelligence that propels organizations forward by building a connected network where decisions continuously improve through collective learning. While businesses can start small, true people-centric decision intelligence requires a strategic mindset. This release redefines decision-making by putting people at the center, simplifying complex systems, and promoting collaboration and automation. The new Aera Decision Cloud isnt just an enhancement; its a transformative step toward a system that adapts and evolves with your business, not just solving problems but elevating your organizations ability to innovate and grow.

title.en-US: Procurement as a Catalyst for Supply Chain Transformation: Driving Revenue and Reducing Costs

content.en-US:
![2024 12 Procurement as a Catalyst for Supply Chain Transformation Blog Image](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/3GF5KHJc7ybdkZLdV2O9lo/f2273d265c73092384c24cec810cedaa/2024_12_Procurement_as_a_Catalyst_for_Supply_Chain_Transformation_Blog_Image.jpg) In the dynamic and competitive global marketplace, businesses constantly seek innovative ways to gain an edge. One of the most impactful approaches is transforming the supply chain into a robust, efficient, and responsive system that can adapt to changing market conditions. At the heart of this transformation lies procurement a function that has evolved beyond its traditional role as a cost-cutting department into a strategic driver of business success. Modern procurement does far more than source goods and services; it fosters supplier innovation, mitigates risks, and aligns with organizational goals to create long-term value. Leveraging decision intelligence to optimize the procurement process is a key enabler of this transformation, unlocking new levels of efficiency and strategic insight. This blog post explores how procurement drives supply chain transformation, enabling businesses to boost revenue and reduce costs while building a resilient and sustainable future. ### The Strategic Evolution of Procurement Procurement has undergone a significant transformation in recent years. What was once a transactional function is now a key driver of strategic value for organizations. The shift from cost-centric procurement to a more value-oriented approach reflects a broader change in the way companies view their supply chains. Procurement teams today are tasked with managing supplier relationships, driving innovation, reducing risk, and aligning purchasing strategies with business objectives. This expanded scope not only enhances supply chain performance but also contributes to overall organizational success. By embracing a strategic role, procurement teams become key players in the transformation of supply chains into competitive advantages. ### Procurement as a Driver of Revenue Growth Procurements impact on revenue generation is often overlooked, yet it plays a vital role in creating opportunities for growth. When aligned with strategic goals, procurement can drive innovation, enhance supplier performance, and open doors to new markets. __Innovation through Strategic Partnerships.__ Procurement fosters innovation by building strategic partnerships with suppliers who bring unique capabilities, technologies, and expertise. These partnerships enable organizations to develop innovative products, optimize processes, and introduce new services. For example, a company collaborating with a supplier on advanced materials might develop products with enhanced performance or sustainability features, allowing it to capture new market segments or command premium prices. __Enhancing Supplier Performance.__ A strong procurement function ensures suppliers deliver consistent quality and meet performance standards. By implementing performance improvement programs and fostering a culture of collaboration, procurement can drive supplier excellence. High-performing suppliers contribute to superior products and services, improving customer satisfaction and loyalty key drivers of revenue growth. __Market Expansion and Localization.__ Expanding into new markets often requires adapting products and supply chains to local needs. Procurement plays a central role in this process by sourcing materials locally, building relationships with regional suppliers, and reducing logistical complexities. Localization not only reduces costs but also enhances customer satisfaction by delivering products tailored to specific regional preferences. __Sustainability and Brand Value.__ Todays consumers increasingly prioritize sustainability, and procurement is at the forefront of this shift. By sourcing ethically and sustainably, organizations can enhance their brand reputation, attract environmentally conscious customers, and foster loyalty. These efforts not only benefit the planet but also drive long-term revenue growth by aligning with consumer values. ### Procurements Role in Reducing Supply Chain Costs While procurements ability to drive revenue growth is crucial, its cost-reduction capabilities remain a cornerstone of its value proposition. From strategic sourcing to risk mitigation, procurement ensures supply chains operate efficiently and cost-effectively. __Cost-Efficient Sourcing.__ Strategic sourcing is one of procurements most powerful tools for cost reduction. By analyzing supplier markets, leveraging economies of scale, and negotiating favorable terms, procurement teams secure the best value for goods and services. Cost-efficient sourcing ensures organizations achieve savings without compromising quality. __Optimizing Inventory Levels.__ Effective inventory management is critical to supply chain efficiency. Procurement collaborates with supply chain planners to strike a balance between overstocking and understocking, reducing carrying costs and preventing disruptions. Techniques such as just-in-time (JIT) procurement minimize inventory levels, cutting storage costs while ensuring timely availability of materials. __Supplier Consolidation.__ Working with a large number of suppliers can lead to inefficiencies and higher costs. Procurement streamlines supply chains by consolidating suppliers, enabling bulk purchasing, and simplifying logistics. A smaller, more strategic supplier base reduces administrative costs and fosters stronger partnerships. __Technology Integration.__ Procurements adoption of technology has transformed how businesses manage supply chains. Tools like e-procurement platforms, artificial intelligence (AI)-driven analytics, and supplier relationship management (SRM) systems automate repetitive tasks, enhance decision-making, and provide real-time insights. These technologies improve efficiency and reduce costs by identifying opportunities for optimization. __Risk Management and Cost Avoidance.__ Supply chain disruptions can be costly and damaging to an organizations reputation. Procurement plays a vital role in identifying and mitigating risks, from geopolitical events to supplier insolvencies. By diversifying supplier networks, implementing contingency plans, and monitoring risks proactively, procurement prevents disruptions and avoids unnecessary costs. ### How Procurement Drives Supply Chain Transformation To truly transform the supply chain, procurement must go beyond operational efficiency and assume a strategic role. By aligning procurement with broader organizational goals, businesses can unlock the full potential of their supply chains. Heres how procurement enables transformation: __Adopting a Total-Cost-of-Ownership Approach.__ Procurement teams increasingly focus on total cost of ownership (TCO), which considers all costs associated with a product or service over its lifecycle, including acquisition, maintenance, and disposal. By taking a TCO approach, organizations can make more informed decisions that maximize long-term value rather than focusing solely on upfront savings. __Leveraging Data and Analytics.__ Data has become a cornerstone of modern procurement. Predictive analytics and machine learning tools allow procurement teams to anticipate demand, identify cost-saving opportunities, and make data-driven decisions. These insights empower organizations to adapt to market changes and maintain a competitive edge. __Cross-Functional Collaboration.__ Procurements impact is magnified when it works closely with other departments, such as operations, finance, and sales. Cross-functional collaboration ensures alignment of goals, efficient resource allocation, and seamless execution of supply chain initiatives. This integrated approach accelerates transformation efforts and improves outcomes across the board. __Sustainability and ESG Alignment.__ Environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations are now integral to supply chain strategies. Procurement leads the charge in adopting sustainable practices, such as sourcing renewable materials, minimizing waste, and ensuring ethical labor practices. These efforts not only reduce costs through improved resource efficiency but also enhance the organizations reputation and compliance with regulations. __Investing in Talent and Technology.__ Building a skilled procurement team and equipping them with advanced tools are critical to driving transformation. Training programs, certifications, and upskilling initiatives ensure procurement professionals can navigate the complexities of modern supply chains. Similarly, investing in cutting-edge technologies enhances decision-making, streamlines processes, and improves overall efficiency. ### Optimizing the Procurement Process with Decision Intelligence

One of these technologies is decision intelligence. Aera Procurement Skills, an integral part of the Aera Decision Cloud, are specifically designed to streamline and optimize the procurement process, leveraging automation to handle daily tasks while providing the visibility needed to enhance and automate sourcing decisions. The skills address the challenges of managing modern procurement complexities, such as sourcing raw materials and semi-finished goods from thousands of suppliers across disparate systems and multiple collaboration mechanisms, including EDI, emails, and phone calls.

Focusing on direct procurement, the Procurement Skills emphasize key processes like RFQs, POs, and related transactions that drive material purchasing essential to margin, performance, and competitive advantage. By integrating procurement strategy with daily operations, they automate decision-making and execution, recommending suppliers based on performance, cost, timeliness, and other priorities. ![Screenshot 2024-12-03 at 11.55.40 AM](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/5JtjyA3c6RUd4ffMMyrfp3/561977d2445d5227cca68bbf571e7484/Screenshot_2024-12-03_at_11.55.40_AM.png)
Aera Procurement Skills dramatically streamline the procurement process by automating daily procurement tasks while giving the visibility required to augment and automate decision-making on sourcing.
Key capabilities in this set of skills include proactively ensuring contract compliance, predicting supplier delivery delays, and offering actionable recommendations to address supply exceptions. This comprehensive approach enables organizations to increase buyer productivity, adhere to production schedules, measure supplier performance, and minimize costs. Included among the set of Procurement Skills is the Supply Resilience Skill, a powerful feature that enhances supply chain resilience by proactively identifying at-risk suppliers and assessing their potential impact on operations. By analyzing diverse data sources, the Supply Resilience Skill provides actionable insights and recommends alternative suppliers or strategies to mitigate supply risks. This capability ensures continuity in the supply chain, reducing disruptions and safeguarding critical procurement activities. Integrated seamlessly into the broader set of Procurement Skills, the Supply Resilience Skill complements other automation and analytics features, further strengthening an organizations ability to manage complex sourcing environments while maintaining agility and efficiency.

Altogether, Aera Procurement Skills transform purchasing into a more strategic function, enabling businesses to drive performance, optimize costs, and maintain a competitive edge. Moreover, were proud to share that these procurement optimization benefits have captured the attention of several leading industry organizations. The Aera Decision Cloud was recently selected as one of the most pioneering Analytics, Data, and Intelligence solutions in the 2024 ProcureTech100, an annual list spotlighting forward-thinking enterprise procurement solutions. Additionally, Aera earned a spot on Spend Matters 50 Providers to Watch, a recognition of emerging companies driving innovation in procurement technology. Among analyst firms, Aera was featured in a Gartner Research report on supply chain orchestration platforms, which leverage harmonized data to prescribe and execute responsive decisions that drive supply chain business value. The platform was also named a Leader in the 2024 IDC MarketScape for Decision Intelligence Platforms.

### The Future of Procurement in Supply Chain Transformation Procurements role in supply chain transformation will only grow in importance as organizations face new challenges and opportunities. From navigating geopolitical uncertainties to addressing sustainability demands, procurement will continue to be a key driver of innovation, resilience, and efficiency. Organizations that embrace procurement as a strategic function will be better equipped to adapt to market changes and create value for stakeholders. By integrating procurement into the fabric of supply chain strategies, businesses can achieve a competitive edge and build a foundation for sustainable growth.

The next frontier for procurement lies in leveraging advanced technologies like decision intelligence to unlock deeper insights and optimize every aspect of the supply chain. To learn more about how decision intelligence can help realize this potential, watch our video, How Aera Decision Cloud Transforms Procurement.

title.en-US: The Future of Food & Beverage Supply Chains: Smarter, Faster, More Sustainable

content.en-US:
![2024 12 The Future of Food & Beverage Supply Chains Cover](//images.ctfassets.net/mh1amgo8m7ts/5PBlAfBMhsr7cWVLBtFzZh/a62bb95aa4b0817fd7eaea73d2276523/2024_12_The_Future_of_Food___Beverage_Supply_Chains_Cover.jpg) The food and beverage (F&B) industry operates in one of the most dynamic and challenging environments today. Its an industry that feeds the world while managing intricate supply chain networks spanning producers, manufacturers, distributors, and retailers. Companies face a constantly shifting landscape of rising costs, climate-driven disruptions, evolving consumer demands, and ever-tightening regulations. F&B businesses must remain profitable, deliver quality products, and operate sustainablyall while responding to disruptions that can alter supply chain dynamics overnight. Rising raw material, energy, and labor costs have created financial strain for many companies. At the same time, unpredictable weather patterns and transportation delays disrupt logistics, making it harder to deliver products on time. Consumers are also becoming more discerning, seeking healthier, transparent, and personalized options, which complicates demand forecasting. Meanwhile, digital transformation is accelerating the speed and complexity of supply chain operations, as companies adopt new technologies to stay competitive. While these advancements offer significant opportunities, they also introduce additional layers of pressure, requiring businesses to adapt faster than ever before. Governments and regulators are also enforcing stricter standards for food safety and sustainability, leaving businesses with less flexibility and higher stakes in supply chain management. Traditional tools and approaches are proving inadequate in the face of these challenges. Static systems, manual workflows, and siloed data cannot keep pace with the industrys need for speed, precision, and adaptability. To thrive, F&B companies need a new approach one that not only addresses these challenges but turns them into opportunities. This is where decision intelligence steps in. ### Decision Intelligence: A New Era of Supply Chain Management By integrating artificial intelligence, machine learning, and human expertise, decision intelligence transforms supply chain management, enabling companies to make smarter, faster, and more consistent decisions. The result? Enhanced resilience, operational efficiency, and sustainable growth in an increasingly unpredictable world. Aera, the decision intelligence agent, empowers businesses to navigate complexity with smarter, faster, and more consistent decision-making. It revolutionizes supply chain management through its advanced capabilities, which are specifically designed to address the unique challenges of the F&B industry: __1. Decision Data Model__
Aera harmonizes data from diverse internal and external sources into a single, AI-ready framework. By breaking down silos, this capability provides real-time visibility across the supply chain, enabling F&B businesses to make informed decisions based on the most accurate and up-to-date information. Instead of wasting time on manual data consolidation or dealing with fragmented insights, companies can operate from a single source of truth that integrates transactional, analytical, and decision data seamlessly. __2. Composite AI for Advanced Intelligence__
Leveraging machine learning, optimization, and simulation, Aeras Composite AI delivers prescriptive and adaptive recommendations tailored to the complexities of F&B supply chains. It doesnt just analyze data it understands it in context, combining advanced analytics with the business expertise of planners. The agent learns continuously, refining its recommendations based on feedback, ensuring decisions become more precise and effective over time. This capability transforms decision-making from a static process into a dynamic, continuously improving cycle. __3. Intuitive User Engagement__
Aeras user interface is designed to adapt to the needs of its users, providing natural, conversational AI interactions that make advanced tools accessible even to non-technical users. By offering personalized recommendations and tailored insights, the agent enhances user engagement and ensures planners can operate more effectively. This capability reduces inefficiencies by shifting the focus from users learning the system to the system learning from users, creating a seamless decision-making experience. __4. Automation and Workflow Integration__
Aera automates repetitive and time-consuming tasks, enabling F&B supply chain planners to focus on strategic initiatives. With intuitive process builders, companies can streamline workflows and scale decision automation to meet evolving business demands. Real-time execution is enabled through seamless integration with operational systems, ensuring decisions are implemented quickly and efficiently. __5. Continuous Learning for Smarter Decisions__
Unlike traditional tools that rely on static rules, Aera continuously learns from decision outcomes to refine its recommendations. This feedback-driven improvement ensures that decisions become more aligned with strategic objectives over time. As the supply chain evolves, the agent adapts, making it a future-proof solution capable of navigating even the most unpredictable conditions. The platform manifests these capabilities through a combination of configurable __skills__, giving the agent the ability to understand, recommend, and act on any set of business decision needs. These skills aggregate and harmonize data in real time, and apply artificial intelligence and decision logic to make recommendations and execute decisions autonomously all while learning continuously to improve future recommendations. Leveraging these skills and capabilities collectively, Aera transforms supply chain management into a proactive, intelligent process. By turning data into actionable insights, automating complexity, and continuously learning from outcomes, the agent empowers F&B companies to navigate uncertainty with confidence. Decision intelligence is not just a tool for addressing todays challenges it is the foundation for building resilient, efficient, and sustainable supply chains that can thrive in an ever-changing world. ### Transforming Supply Chains: Real-World Impact Food and beverage (F&B) supply chains are facing unprecedented challenges, from unpredictable demand patterns and sustainability pressures to logistical inefficiencies and the increasing complexity of operations. Aeras advanced capabilities address these issues, delivering transformative impact across five key areas: __1. Improved Inventory Performance__
Managing perishable goods requires precision, and Aera equips businesses with the tools to achieve it. Through a centralized Control Tower skill, the agent provides real-time visibility into inventory levels and movements. Demand Forecasting aligns inventory with anticipated needs, while Dynamic Safety Stock Adjustments recalibrate inventory in response to real-time variability. The agent also redistributes aging inventory proactively, reducing spoilage and freeing up valuable working capital. __2. Reduced Waste__
Waste management is a critical concern for F&B companies, and Aera addresses this with predictive insights and automated workflows. Aging Inventory Management ensures that at-risk stock is redistributed before spoilage occurs. Demand Sensing aligns inventory distribution with real-time demand, while sustainability tracking helps businesses measure and reduce environmental impact, aligning waste reduction with broader operational goals. __3. Optimized Logistics__
Logistics inefficiencies often lead to increased costs and carbon emissions. Aera optimizes transportation planning by improving truck utilization and streamlining shipment schedules. Real-time logistics monitoring identifies and mitigates potential disruptions, ensuring smooth and cost-effective operations. Additionally, the agent integrates CO2 emissions tracking to help F&B companies align logistics practices with sustainability goals. __4. Enhanced Service Levels__
Meeting customer expectations requires agility and precision, which Aera delivers through its Demand Forecasting and Stockout Prevention skills. By anticipating demand and addressing potential gaps in supply, the agent ensures that products are available where and when they are needed. This proactive approach strengthens supply chain reliability and builds customer trust, aligning inventory strategies with market demands. __5. Decreased Planner Effort__
F&B supply chain planners face growing complexity, but Aera simplifies their workload by automating routine tasks. Its intuitive interface provides actionable insights, allowing planners to focus on strategic decision-making rather than repetitive processes. By equipping planners with real-time data and prescriptive recommendations, the agent enables faster, more informed decisions, improving both efficiency and adaptability. These capabilities empower F&B companies to overcome operational challenges and build more resilient, efficient, and sustainable supply chains. By addressing key pain points across inventory, waste, logistics, service levels, and workforce productivity, Aera drives meaningful transformation in a rapidly changing industry. ### A Call to Action: Lead with Decision Intelligence The food and beverage industry is at a critical juncture, where the ability to adapt, innovate, and operate efficiently is no longer optional it is essential for survival and growth. As disruptions become more frequent, sustainability expectations intensify, and customer demands grow more complex, the need for a smarter, more proactive approach to supply chain management has never been greater. Aera offers the tools and capabilities to navigate this complexity with confidence. By operationalizing AI, automating routine processes, and fostering continuous learning, the agent enables F&B businesses to transform their supply chains into adaptive, resilient systems that deliver measurable outcomes. From improving forecast accuracy and reducing waste to optimizing logistics and empowering teams, decision intelligence represents a new standard in supply chain management. This is an opportunity to move beyond reactive strategies and build food and beverage supply chains that are agile, efficient, and sustainable supply chains that not only respond to change but also shape the future. Organizations that embrace decision intelligence today will position themselves as leaders in a rapidly evolving industry. Investing in intelligent, data-driven decision-making is more than a response to todays challenges it is a commitment to long-term excellence and innovation.

For details and real-world examples on how Aeras capabilities in decision intelligence deliver measurable improvements across five key areas for leading F&B companies, download the whitepaper, The AI Recipe for the Future of Food and Beverage Supply Chains.
